document.docAuthor: Cao, Liangming, Rédei, Dávid, Li, Hu & Cai, Wanzhi
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Acanthaspis Amyot & Serville (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Reduviinae) from China, with new records of species to adjacent countries

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Acanthaspis Amyot & Serville (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Reduviidae: Reduviinae) from China, with new records of species to adjacent countries

bibRefCitation.author: Hsiao, T. Y.
bibRefCitation.refString: Hsiao, T. Y. (1976) A summarized report on Reduviinae of China (Hemiptera: Reduviidae). Acta Zootaxonomica Sinica, 19, 77 - 93.

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription . Colouration . Dark brown to black. First antennal segment, markings on posterior pronotal lobe, lateral portions and apical spine of scutellum, base of corium and a subapical spots, veins, annulations on femur and tibia, posterior half of each connexival segment pale yellow to yellow; spots besides ocellar area, two lateral spots on anterior pronotal lobe pale yellow to brown; tarsi brown ( Figs 157 , 218 ).

Measurements [in mm, ♂ (n= 7) / ♀ (n= 8)]. Body length 18.1–19.2/20.3–21.1; maximum width of abdomen 5.3–6.2/6.5–7.0; head length 2.93–3.2/2.91–3.1; length of anteocular part 1.6–1.73/1.3–1.45; length of postocular part 0.8–0.91/0.7–0.78; length of synthlipsis 0.64–0.67/0.7–0.81; interocellar space 1.91–0.2/1.93–0.21; length of antennal segments I–IV= 2.4–2.81/2.5–2.7, 4.1/3.7–4.4, 4.8/5.0–5.3, 2.8–3.5/2.7–3.6; length of visible rostral segments I–III= 1.62–1.75/1.69–1.8, 1.19–1.2/1.25–1.32, 0.57–0.6/0.55–0.62; length of anterior lobe of pronotum 1.61–1.72/1.5–1.76; length of posterior lobe of pronotum 2.2–2.6/2.17–2.34; maximum width of thorax 4.7–5.1/ 4.92–5.7; length of scutellum 1.76–1.9/1.7–1.93; length of hemelytron 11.2–13.3/12.5–13.2.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 157.
Acanthaspis picta Hsiao
, ♂. Habitus. Scale bar = 2.67 mm.

FIGURES 158–168.
Acanthaspis picta Hsiao
, ♂. 158, Head and pronotum, antennae removed; 159, 160, pygophore; 161, median pygophore process; 162, basal plate and basal plate bridge; 163–165, paramere; 166–168, phallus. 158, 160, 168, lateral view; 159, 167, ventral view; 161, caudal view; 162, 166, dorsal view. Scale bar of 158 = 1.60 mm; of 159–161 = 1.00 mm; of 162–168 = 0.63 mm.

FIGURE 169. Distribution of
Acanthaspis picta Hsiao
in China.

Distribution in China
. China: Yunnan (Yuanjiang, Simao, Xiaomengyang, Menghai, Mengla, Ganlanba) ( Fig. 169 ).

Distribution outside China
. Laos, Myanmar, Thailand.

Remarks . This species is similar to
A . laoensis Distant
in colour pattern, but this species about 19 mm and much larger (vs. much smaller in
A . laoensis
, about 15 mm ).
